page.title: 11The Basingstoke Canal,Woking
page.content: The Basingstoke Canal which runs through our block was begun in 1788 and opened in 1794, linking Basingstoke to the Thames via the Wey Navigation at Byfleet. It has been disused for many years and the water has become stagnant. Parts are being rebuilt by volunteers from the Basingstoke Canal Preservation Trust who are also clearing it of the silt and weeds which have choked it for many years. A new canal-side restaurant has been opened at Bridge Barn and it is hoped that the renovated canal may become a local amenity instead of an eyesore. The lock by the Sheerwater Road has been rebuilt and is standing empty at present. The wooden bridge over it has been renewed and the tow path has been cleared of brambles and re-gravelled.
